Struct netcdf_reader_t¶

  • Defined in File netcdf_reader_t.h

Struct Documentation¶

struct netcdf_reader_t¶

Public Functions

netcdf_reader_t(const uint32_t &buffer_size)¶

Parameters

  • buffer_size: Number of time steps to read at once

template<class float_t>
int read_buffer(model_constants_t<float_t> &cc, const reference_quantities_t &ref_quant, std::vector<float_t> &y_single_old, std::vector<float_t> &inflows, const uint32_t &step, const bool &checkpoint_flag, const bool &start_over_env)¶

Read data from the buffer and store in in y_single_old and inflows. If the buffer has been read completely, the next few datapoints are loaded from the netCDF file via buffer_params().

Return

SUCCESS or with #def TRUSTED_DATA INPUT_NAN_ERR, otherwise throws an error.

Parameters

  • cc: Model constants. On out: Added number of simulation steps

  • ref_quant: Reference quantities used to change from netcdf units to simulation units

  • y_single_old: Vector with (possibly updated) model state variables after return

  • inflows: Vector with inflow from above after return

  • step: Current iteration step

  • checkpoint_flag: If true: do not update model state

  • start_over_env: If true: update environment/thermodynamics

template<class float_t>
void set_dims(const char *input_file, model_constants_t<float_t> &cc, const int &simulation_mode)¶

Set dimids of this object and set the maximum amount of trajectories and ensembles in cc. Sets pressure in reference quantities. Default is 1e5 for Pa, otherwise hPa with 1e3 is possible as well.

Parameters

  • input_file: Path to file to read

  • cc: Model constants with number of ensembles and trajectories on return

  • simulation_mode: The simulation mode defined on the command line

template<class float_t>
void init_netcdf(const char *input_file, const bool &checkpoint_flag, model_constants_t<float_t> &cc, const int &simulation_mode, const double current_time, const reference_quantities_t &ref_quant)¶

Read initial values from the netcdf file and stores them to y_init. Also stores the amount of trajectories in the input file and several quantities to cc such as the number of steps to simulate.

Return

Errorcode (0=no errors; 1=simulation breaking error)

Parameters

  • input_file: Path to input netcdf file as char array

  • checkpoint_flag: Is this already initialized via a checkpoint?

  • cc: Model constants. On out: Added number of simulation steps

  • simulation_mode: Needed to define if parallel access to the file is possible.

  • current_time: Time in seconds from a checkpoint

template<class float_t>
void read_initial_values(std::vector<double> &y_init, const reference_quantities_t &ref_quant, model_constants_t<float_t> &cc, const bool &checkpoint_flag, const uint64_t &traj_id, const uint64_t &ens_id)¶
template<class float_t>
void read_initial_values(std::vector<double> &y_init, const reference_quantities_t &ref_quant, model_constants_t<float_t> &cc, const bool &checkpoint_flag)¶

Read values for initializing a simulation.

Parameters

  • y_init: Array of num_comp many doubles

  • ref_quant: Reference quantities used to change from netcdf units to simulation units

  • checkpoint_flag: Is this already initialized via a checkpoint?

  • cc: Model constants. On out: Added number of simulation steps

  • checkpoint_flag: Wether the data is already there due to loading a checkpoint

double get_lon(const uint32_t &t, const uint32_t &sub) const¶
